body.name: Sauder Miscellaneous Storage 5 Bookcase/Book Shelf, L: 35.28" x W: 13.23" x H: 69.76", Estate Black
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 21 mins
features: Three adjustable shelves for flexible storage options
Quick and easy assembly with patented slide-on moldings to save you time
Assembled dimensions: L: 35.276" x W: 13.228" x H: 69.764"
Five open storage shelves for your favorite home décor.
Finished on all sides for versatile placement anywhere in your home.
body.description: There is no such thing as too much storage space. Add a little extra storage to your home décor with this handsome 5-shelf bookcase form the Sauder Select collection. This tall bookcase features five spacious shelves for you to store and display anything from your collection of novels, work binders, and storage bins to decorative plants, your assortment of knick-knacks, and pictures of family and friends. Three of the shelves are adjustable so you can move them to the specific height and placement to fit all your needs. It has room to accommodate all your storage and display needs! This versatile bookcase adds simple style and elegance that is sure to stand out in any room of your home – living room, dining room, office, or even the bedroom! Finished in a classy Estate Black®, this good-looking 5-shelf bookcase gives your home the style you want with the functionality that you need.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’m very pleased with this Sauder bookcase. It’s attractive, easy to assemble and very sturdy. This is not the first piece of Sauder furniture that I’ve purchased and like the rest, it does have a slight odor until it airs out for a day or two. That being said, the overall quality of the product and value for your your money make this bookcase a great purchase. Additionally, the bookcase was delivered when promised and arrived without any damage. I would highly recommend this seller and product again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best looking cheap bookshelves
reviews.reviewText: I’ve put together a million Ikea bookshelves. I know cheap bookshelves. These are about equal to IKEA’s cheapest bookshelves, maybe a little sturdier than that. They’re also a real pain to put together, even compared to Ikea.BUT THIS IS A FIVE STAR REVIEW! I’m giving five stars because these are absolutely great looking shelves, and they’re a good value for the money. If you wanted solid wood shelves you wouldn’t be reading this review. The cardboard backing looks awful but you won’t see that when the shelves are full of books. This is one of the best furniture buys I’ve ever made on Amazon, I like these better than anything else I’ve ever seen at this price point.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not so easy to assemble
reviews.reviewText: The only thing I didn’t like was that in spite of the packing, there was minor damage in a couple places that had to be touched up. Not that easy to assemble but the directions are pretty well written.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Great looking shelf. For the most part it was simple to put together with the exception of a couple of parts. It looks amazing in our space and gives us so much more room for our books and decorations. Looks more expensive than what it actually is. Was a little wobbly before putting the back boards on, but seems to hold up alright. Definitely recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful furniture piece

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: We ordered 3 for our home office. One was missing a piece but the seller was very quick and professional in their response and sent a replacement piece. We are very happy with our purchase and the exceptional customer service. The book shelves are heavy duty and sturdy. Definitely recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Trash with good instructions
reviews.reviewText: The instructions are excellent, among the best I've come across, but that only goes so far when the product itself is cheap and collapses in upon itself.The five shelf bookcase is basically two parts: a three shelf upper bookcase, and a lower two shelf bookcase. You would think that they would secure themselves together solidly, but no. They are connected cams, the dowels of which just loosly friction into the cheap particle board. It cracks and bends when trying ti assemble it, making it nearly impossible to line everything up.The only sturdy part of the build are the back panels, which have to be nailed in. They are so sturdy in fact, that when I finished putting everything together, and the bookcase buckled under its own weight, the back panels and the nails tore right through the cheap a** particle board and ruined any hope of salvaging the build.I had been told that Sauder was a reputible brand, but I am extremely dissappointed in the quality of product I recieved.Your mileage may vary, but I would choose something else.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Hard to build, pieces don't fit well, bottom has come completely detached from the top
reviews.reviewText: I just moved for grad school, and was looking to get 2 bookshelves on a budget. At the time it wasn't possible to get IKEA bookshelves, so I figured I would get 2 pairs of these bookshelves, based on the review. I then spent about 8 hours of hell assembling this bookshelf. I ended up returning the 2nd one without opening the box. I would've returned the 1st one as well, but by the time you're about half way through building this any return would be pretty much impossible.The instructions are rather opaque and incredibly unclear. I found myself staring at them for quite a bit before I knew what to do (and sometimes that wasn't correct. With the way you are meant to set this up you must build this incredibly heavy bookshelf upside down, while simultaneously connecting the trims it has. These trims don't actually fit snuggly with the bookshelf (see photos above), which is aesthetically unappealing (kind of counter to the whole point of the bookshelf). Because the wood is not finished on the shelves, removing them would leave a bunch of unfinished board. The trim on the bookshelves is also incredibly hard to slide on. I ended up using a mallet/using as much downward pressure on the trim as I could to get it into place.If it were just the aesthetic part of building this that was the problem, I probably would have rated it a 3 & returned the 2nd one.The bookshelf is basically 2 parts, rather than 2 long boards. Somehow the dowels, which are meant to connect the top part of the bookshelf and the bottom completely stripped, leaving me with a bookshelf that was splitting basically down the middle. By soldiering through & attaching the back I was able to lift up the bookshelf without it splitting apart entirely, and then I got up on a step ladder and shoved the dowel and hole into place using my weight to force the pieces back together.Even if built professionally, I'm not sure how one would deal with the issue of the trim. You can kind of put the trim into place so from afar you can't see the problems, but that's honestly such a strange design choice to me.
